page.title: 01Uffington White Horse Hill
page.content: The Northern slopes of the Wessex Downs fall to the Vale of the White Horse. The area is dominated by the White Horse Hill, with its ancient styalised Horse & the Hill Fort of Uffington Castle, owned by the National Trust & open to the public. It is farming country - crops, cattle & sheep: there is also a stud farm near Woolstone. There is no other industry. The villages in the vale are small & attractive. Few of the inhabitants are now needed to work on the land, many are retired - often from professional classes, whilst most others have a variety of occupations in towns & larger villages & a few commute to London. Public transport is minimal but almost every family has a car or access to one.
